arts.ttl: Exeter City pick up vital point at Reading to help relegation fight
arts.sum: A flat first half was short of real chances, with Joe Whitworth denying Harvey Knibbs with a smart save as close as either side came as the Grecians frustrated the play-off chasers. Trevitt for City saw a shot deflected wide, but chances were not a plenty in a rather flat opening 30 minutes.

arts.ttl: Ed Turns shows Exeter City fans his class on league debut
arts.sum: Exeter City defender Ed Turns was delighted to get back on the pitch and finally make his league debut for the Grecians – and starred in ensuring it was marked with a clean sheet. Turns, Angus MacDonald and Alex Hartridge kept the Royals’ attack quiet, and when needed, Joe Whitworth made important saves as City earned only a second clean sheet in four months in League One.

arts.ttl: Reading have Exeter City wastefulness to thank for eventful Exeter City stalemate
arts.sum: Reading had Exeter City's wastefulness to thank as their unbeaten run stretched to seven matches following a 0-0 draw at the Select Car Leasing Stadium. The Grecians had chance after chance in the second half but were unable to convert, while the Royals largely frustrated as they were unable to break down the relegation-threatened side. Noel Hunt named an unchanged side from Saturday's 2-1 win over Wigan Athletic, with Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan returning to the bench after his head injury during the last home match against Birmingham City. A low-quality affair played out in front of a season-low crowd of 7,955, neither side created anything of note in the first half. Harvey Knibbs had a shot blocked within three minutes and Billy Bodin volleyed wide from an exquisite Charlie Savage cross-field pass but that was about it in the way of goalmouth action between two sides at differing ends of the table. Despite the lack of saves for either goalkeeper, Reading certainly looked the mo

arts.ttl: Reading left 'frustrated' in stalemate with relegation-threatened Exeter City
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt admitted that his side were left 'frustrated' by relegation-threatened Exeter City in Tuesday's 0-0 draw. The Grecians have won just once in 2025 but looked the more likely to win as the tie wore on while the Royals' best chances came and went in the first half. Now seven matches unbeaten and four points outside the play-offs, Reading head to Crawley Town on Saturday. "I think they came to frustrate us," Hunt said. "If you look at their results, they’re fighting for their lives and every point matters to everybody. There are no easy games. teams are coming here to sit in with a low block and to try and catch us on the counter. I thought in the first half we created some really good opportunities and could have had a couple of goals. "In the second half we got a little bit frustrated in terms of moving the ball and a bit restless. We need to keep our discipline of doing the right things. If teams want to come and sit in, you have to work the football to create chances. We’re seven unbeaten, I thought we defended the cage really well.

arts.ttl: Exeter City suffer injury setbacks ahead of trip to Reading
arts.sum: “Johnly is working with the physios, alongside Fitzy and Yanic (Wildschut), the longer-term injuries, and they all look like they will miss the season,” Caldwell said. EXETER City manager Gary Caldwell has confirmed that defender Johnly Yfeko will miss the rest of the season and fellow defender Jack Fitzwater is also unlikely to play again this campaign.

arts.ttl: Reading’s League One play-off hopes suffer setback with Exeter stalemate
arts.sum: Neither side impressed in a scrappy and goalless first half.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading aim for second win in four days as Exeter City visit
arts.sum: Reading are aiming to go seven matches unbeaten as Exeter City visit the SCL Stadium. Beating Wigan Athletic 2-1 on Saturday, the Royals sit just three points outside the play-offs ahead of tonight's full League One fixture list.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Noel Hunt named unchanged side for Exeter City visit
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt has named an unchanged side for this evening's clash with Exeter City- although there are two new names on the bench. The Royals left it late on Saturday but came from behind to beat Wigan Athletic 2-1 at the Brick Community Stadium, a sixth match unbeaten. Joel Pereira remains between the sticks, aiming for a second successive home clean sheet after the stalemate with Birmingham City last time out, while the back four remains Tivonge Rushesha, Tyler Bindon, Amadou Mbengue and Andre Garcia. Lewis Wing keeps the armband in midfield, with club captain Andy Yiadom on the bench, alongside Charlie Savage and Harvey Knibbs.

arts.ttl: EFL confirm dates for League One final day- including possible Reading play-off games
arts.sum: The English Football League have confirmed the dates for the end of the season, including the play-offs. Reading sit ninth in League One, three points outside the play-offs, with 13 matches remaining. The Royals host Barnsley on the final day, who currently sit only one point and one place below Noel Hunt's side. On Saturday, May 3, all three of the Championship, League One and League Two will reach their conclusions. While the second tier kicks off at 12.30pm, with the third and fourth tiers remaining 3pm kick offs.

arts.ttl: From Munich to Florida: Mamadi Camara debut XI as winger celebrates Reading milestone
arts.sum: Reading winger Mamadi Camara celebrated his 50th appearance for the club in Saturday's 2-1 win at Wigan Athletic. Starting out wide in place of Chem Campbell, the 21-year-old made his debut off the bench back in January 2021 for Veljko Paunovic in an FA Cup third round defeat to Luton Town, held behind-closed-doors due to the Covid-19 pandemic. In the four years that have followed, the Guinea-Bissau international has struggled for regular game time but scored four goals last season and has another four so far this campaign. Take a look below at the side named by Paunovic at Kenilworth Road back in 2021 and where they are now.
